subject: Languages
title: Scientific Latin: Naming the Natural World
description: A short lesson to help you apply Scientific Latin: Naming the Natural World.

hook.text: Every species on Earth has a Latin name. Homo sapiens means 'wise human' â€” a debatable claim.

buildup.text: Carl Linnaeus chose Latin for his naming system in 1735 because it was universal among scholars.

discovery.text: Latin names prevent confusion â€” the 'robin' in America and Britain are completely different birds.

twist.text: Scientists still coin new Latin names. Tyrannosaurus rex means 'tyrant lizard king.'

climax.text: Medical, legal, and biological Latin means the language has more daily users than ever.

punchline.text: Latin is 'dead' but names every living thing on the planet. Some death.

quiz.question: Why did Linnaeus choose Latin for species names?
options: It was universally understood among scholars
